subject: Survived Another Xmas
event: Another Christmas has come and gone. I have to admit, Halloween and Thanksgiving are my favorite holidays. Christmas has always been too stressful, at least since I became an adult (a long long time ago). But this year's was relatively mellow. I spent it at home with Parris, friends, and cats, and a good time was had by all. There are things I like about Christmas, though. Watching Christmas movies, especially. A CHRISTMAS STORY is a favorite, and I also like to binge watch all the various versions of the Dickens classic CHRISTMAS CAROL. Alastair Sim, George C. Scott, Reginald Owen, Mickey Mouse, Albert Finney, Bill Murray... they all have their points, and it's fun to compare and contrast. On balance, I still think the Sim is the best of the adaptations. And when you cross over to the parody side of the ledger, there's nothing but nothing comes close to the Blackadder version. This year we also watched FOOTLIGHT PARADE, which has nothing to do with Christmas but is a fun film. One of the last of the great pre-Code films, it's amazing to see how risque it is compared to what Hollywood would be making a year later and for decades to follow. And the musical numbers are unforgettable, especially Cagney in "Looking for My Shanghai Lil." Anyway... merry merry to all my friends, fans, and readers out there. I hope Santa was good to you. At least those of you who were nice. As for those of you who were naughty.. come sit here next to me.

comments.article: Merry Christmas to you and your family, Mr. Martin. Thanks for sharing your work with all of us and we can't wait to see what you have in store for us in 2017.
comments.subject: Merry Christmas

comments.article: I agree Sim's is still the best adaptation- I actually think Mr Magoo's version is my second favorite. Maybe childhood nostalgia but I love it. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!
comments.subject: How about Magoo's version?

comments.article: Hahaa I came here to ask the exact same thing. I love that version.
comments.subject: Re: How about Magoo's version?

comments.article:
Merry Christmas and a happy new year you, too!
I hope you get to relax some more
comments.subject: Merry Christmas

comments.article:
I remember seeing a story on CBS Sunday Morning where they had two Dickens historians both list The Muppets version of A Christmas Carol as their favorites.

Will you be so kind as to give another LAST YEAR(Year in Review) post(s)? Also if you decide to, remember to be careful and take precautions so LiveJournal doesn't erase your posts like last year.
comments.subject: Merry Christmas George!

comments.article: I do believe Muppet's Christmas Carol is a superior version.
comments.subject: Muppet's Christmas Carol

comments.article:
I've been watching the reruns of GOT on Atalantic , even after the amount of times I've seen them , I pick up and hear new things . Great nights viewing still .

Glad your Christmas was enjoyable :)
Very merry Christmas to you George. Please don't be stressed for any reason. Enjoy your life to the fullest. And thanks for everything.

I should really be out hunting wrens today, but you've just sent me way back in time, to watching Footlight Parade whilst under the influence at the Elgin Theatre in NYC (probably as a double feature with 42nd Street or one of the Golddiggers musicals).  Busby Berkeley had to be on something.  Weird dude.
comments.subject: Happy Boxing Day

comments.article: Got your plush doll for Christmas, the battle ready version. Hope you enjoyed your Christmas as much as I did!

Selamat hari Natal dari Indonesia

Salam,
Westeros Indonesia
comments.subject: Merry Christmas from Indonesia

comments.article: I recommend watching Die Hard if you want a good Christmas movie. :)
comments.subject: ...Yippie kayee.

comments.article:
Merry Christmas!

You are right about Blackadder's Christmas Carol, it is superb.

As for the Footlight Parade, Pre-Code stuff is great, Code really changed the landscape. Although Footlight Parade is great and historic in regard to multiple thing, I am somewhat partial to Bacon's previous feature, 42nd Street, which is similar to the Footlight Parade. I don't know whether you watched it, but either way it could make for a nice entertainment next Christmas.

Watching movies for Christmas is great tradition, I frequently watch Ben Hur, it has somehow became quintessential Christmas movie (regrettably, new one is trash)

Enjoy the holidays.
comments.subject: Christmas

comments.article:

The George C. Scott version of A CHRISTMAS CAROL will always be my favorite but Mr. Magoo's is definitely a close second!
Merry Christmas George! Did Santa bring you anything to read? THE LIES OF LOCKE LAMORA was under my tree and I can't wait to start it.

When I was in primary school, I always enjoyed reading, but as I moved into my teenage years I was engulfed by social media instead. For Christmas 2014, my mum and dad got me ASOIAF, which resparked my love for reading. Those books have honestly changed my life. Thank you!
comments.subject: Ahh, Christmas

comments.article: There is a Black Adder Christmas Carol? How have I gone this long without seeing it? I will remedy this oversight, on my part, this evening. Thank you for your faithful tutelage in all that is good.
comments.subject: WHAT?!

comments.article:
All the best to our favourite Santa lookalike!
Things have been pretty quiet here. I'm currently at my Dad's in Hull; he's recently been diagnosed with an inoperable tumour, but he's hoping to keep going for while yet. I've told him there are a couple more seasons at least of GoT to look forward to, as an incentive! I'm looking forward to the next book, too!

George,

I'm glad you had a Merry Christmas, and I wish you a Happy New Year. I do have one question for you, if you don't mind. Do you consider Die Hard to be a Christmas movie? Thanks!
comments.subject: Christmas Movie Opinion

comments.article:
Merry Christmas George. Your alien may be tired, but I'm glad to see you in good spirits. All the best to you and yours.

Merry Christmas!! Wishing you and yours  the best 2017 ever

Only issue is now I don't want to touch it to read it so need to get another one!!!

comments.article: George that's awesome haha, every year me and all my family  just sit back and keep the 24 hour A Christmas Story marathon playing throughout the day. Me and my cousins grew up watching that film on Christmas Eve, such good memories and a hilarious movie.

First Merry Christmas and Happy New Year.

How nice to hear someone else discovered the joys of FOOTLIGHT PARADE. Amazing cast, nicely naughty and amazing dance numbers by Busby Burkeley. I have always loved Ruby Keeler's dancing, but James Cagney is always amazes.
